t: And he said further, 'I will hire thee for a drachma a day, with thy sustenance, as for my son. Therefore, journey with my son,'
and I will add beyond the price agreed.' The angel answered, 'I will go with him; fear not. Our departure shall be in peace, and our return likewise, because the way is safe.'

Then Tobit said unto him, 'God be with thee, brother.' And he called his son, and said unto him, 'Son, prepare what thou needest for the journey, and go thou with thy brother. May God who is in heaven prosper you there, and may his angel keep you company.' So they went forth both, and the young man's dog with him. Tobit then did bid them Godspeed.
But his mother wept, and said unto Tobit, 'Wherefore hast thou sent away my son? Is not he the staff of our hand, in that he goeth in and out before us?'
I hope that money be not before all, but that it be of no account in comparison of our child.
The manner of life that God gave us sufficeth us well.'
Unto her he said, 'Take no thought, our son shall be safe, and shall return again. The day when he shall return, thine eyes shall see him. Therefore, sorrow not, neither fear for them, my sister.'
For a good angel will go with him, his journey shall be prosperous, and he shall return in good health.'
And she ceased then to weep.
And the child departed with the angel, and the dog did follow after them. And they went on their way, and the first night they did lodge by the river Tigris.
And the child went down to wash himself in the river. And as he went down, a fish leaped out of the river, and would have devoured him. Then the lad cried out,
and the angel said unto him, 'Take the fish, and hold him fast.' And the lad laid hold of the fish, and drew it out upon the land.
Unto him, the angel said, 'Open the fish, and take the gall, the heart, and the liver, and lay them up safely.' So the lad did as the angel commanded him.
Then did the young man roast part of the fish, and they did eat, and did keep part for their journey. Then they departed, and they both went on their way till they came near to Media.
Then the lad asked the angel, and said unto him, 'Brother Azarias, what medicine is in the fish's heart, and liver, and gall?'
And he said unto him, 'Touching the heart and the liver, if a devil or an evil spirit trouble any, we must make a smoke thereof before the man or the woman, and the party shall be no more vexed.'
As for the gall, it is good to anoint a man that hath whiteness in his eyes, and he shall see again.
And they came near to Media, and were come near to Ecbatane,
Raphael said to the young man, 'Brother Tobias!' He answered, 'Here I am.' Then he said, 'We must lodge this night with Raguel, who is thy kinsman. He hath a daughter whose name is Sarah,'

but Sarah he hath no child neither son nor daughter, save only Sarah alone. Now thou art nearer of kin unto her than any other man. Therefore thou hast the right to her. The maid is fair and wise, and her father loveth her.'

I pray thee, hear me, brother, for this night we will speak concerning the maid, and make betrothal unto thee. And when we return from Rages, we will celebrate the marriage, for I know that Raguel may not marry her to another according to the law of Moses, or else he shall be worthy of death, for it belongeth to thee before any other to take his daughter. Therefore hear me, brother, and we will speak of her this night, and get her to thee. And when we return from Rages, we will take her and bring her home with us.'

Then Tobias answered Raphael, 'Brother Azarias, I have heard that she hath been given to seven men, who all died in the bridal chamber. Now I am afraid, lest I also die, as the others did, for a wicked spirit loveth her,'

and doth no harm to her, but killeth all that come unto her. And now I am my father's only son, and I fear lest I die, and bring my father's and mother's life because of me to the grave with sorrow, for they have no other son to bury them.'

And he said unto him, 'Dost thou not remember the precepts which thy father gave thee, that thou shouldest take a wife of thine own kindred? Now therefore hear me, brother, and care not for that spirit, for she shall be given thee this night to wife.'
And when thou shalt come into the marriage chamber, thou shalt take the ashes of perfume, and shalt lay upon them some of the heart and liver of the fish, so as to make a smoke,

and the devil shall smell it, and flee away, and never come again any more. But when thou shalt come to her, rise up both of you, and pray to the Lord that he may have mercy upon you and save you. Fear not, for she is appointed unto thee from the beginning, and thou shalt preserve her. She shall be thine, and I trust thou shalt have children of her. Therefore fear not.' When Tobias heard these things, he loved her, and his heart was effectually joined to her.
And when they were come to Ecbatane, they came to the house of Raguel, and Sarah met them. After they had saluted each other, Raguel brought them into his house.
And Raguel said to Edna his wife, 'How like is this young man to Tobit my cousin!'
And Edna asked them, 'From whence are ye, brethren?' To which they replied, 'We are of the sons of Naphtali, who are captives in Nineveh.'
'Do ye know Tobit our kinsman?' And they said, 'We know him.' Then said she, 'Is he in good health?'
'He is both alive, and in good health.' And Tobias said, 'I am his son.'
And Raguel leaped up, and kissed him, and wept.
And then spake he, and said unto him, 'Thou art the son of an honest and good man.' But when he had heard that Tobit was blind, he was sorrowful, and wept.
And likewise Edna his wife and Sarah his daughter wept.

After that he killed a ram out of the flock, and made a feast for them. Then he said to Tobias, 'Brother, thou art welcome to my house: and all things that I have are thine, as well as my daughter.' He commanded them to wash themselves, and when they had washed themselves, and were at rest, Tobias said to Raphael, 'Brother Azarias, speak of those things for which thou wert sent.'

And Raguel said to Tobias, 'Eat and drink, and make merry: For it is meet that thou shouldest marry my daughter Sarah. Nevertheless I will declare unto thee the truth: I have given my daughter to seven men, who died that night they came in unto her.'

But now, my son, be of good cheer, for I will give her to thee.' And Tobias said, 'I will eat nothing here this day, before thou make a league with me.' Raguel said, 'As the Lord liveth, I will give her unto thee, according to the law of Moses.' So he took the right hand of Tobias, and said, 'Be of good cheer, and let us eat and drink, for the Lord hath had mercy on us both.'

Then Raguel called his daughter Sarah, and she came unto him. And he took her by the hand, and gave her to Tobias to be his wife, saying, 'Behold, take her after the law of Moses, and lead her away to thy father. God give you joy and peace.'
Then he called Edna his wife, and took paper, and did write an instrument of covenants, and sealed it.
Then they began to eat.
After Raguel called his wife Edna and said, 'Sister, prepare another chamber, and bring her in thither.'
Which when she had done as he had bidden her, she brought her daughter thither.
And she wept,
and said unto her daughter, 'Be of good comfort, my daughter. The Lord of heaven give thee joy for thy sorrow. Be of good comfort, my daughter.'
And when they had supped, they brought Tobias in unto her.
And as he went, he remembered the words of Raphael, and took the ashes of perfume, and put the heart and the liver of the fish thereupon, and made a smoke.
The which when the evil spirit had smelled, he fled into the uttermost parts of Egypt, and the angel bound him.
And after that Tobias rose up out of the bed, and said unto Sarah, 'Sister, arise, and let us pray that the Lord may have mercy on us.'
And he began to pray, and said, 'Blessed art thou, O God of our fathers, and blessed is thy holy and glorious name for ever; let the heavens bless thee, and all thy creatures.'
Thou madest Adam, and gavest him Eve his wife for an helper and stay: of them came mankind: Thou saidst, It is not good that man should be alone; let us make him an help meet for him.
And now, O Lord, I take not this my sister for lust, but uprightly: therefore have mercy on us both, and let us attain to old age together.'
And she said with him, 'Amen.'
So they slept both that night. And Raguel arose, and went and made a grave,
Saying, 'I fear lest Tobias also be dead.' And when Raguel was come into his house,
he called unto his wife Edna,
and said unto her, 'Send one of thine maids, and let her see whether he be alive: but if he be dead, let us bury him, and no man shall know it.'
So the maid opened the door, and went in, and found them both sound asleep,
and came forth, and told them that he was alive.
Then Raguel praised God, and said, 'O God, thou art worthy to be praised with all pure and holy praise: therefore let thy saints praise thee with all thy creatures;'
Thou art to be praised for ever.'
Thou art worthy to be praised, O God, because thou hast made me glad; and that is not come to pass which I suspected; but thou hast dealt with us according to thy great mercy.'
Thou art worthy to be praised for that thou hast had mercy of two that were the only children of their fathers: grant them mercy, O Lord, and finish their life in health with joy and mercy.
And he commanded his servants to fill up the grave before it was day.
And after that he made a feast for them fourteen days.
Then said Raguel unto Tobias, 'Tarry with me, and I will send to Tobit thy father, that he may be glad.' But Tobias said, 'I may not tarry, but I must go to my father.'
Then Raguel arose, and gave Tobias his daughter Sarah, and half of all his goods, servants, and cattle, and money:

and Raguel blessed them both, and said, 'The God of heaven prosper you, my children.' Raguel also said to Tobias, 'Go, and prepare thyself, and take thy wife with thee. I will send after you, to let you know how I and Edna do.'
So Tobias took Sarah, and they went forth, and Raguel followed him with all his company.

And Tobias blessed Raguel, and Edna his wife, and said unto them, 'I pray you, send my father and mother to me: do not tarry.' Then Raguel took his leave of Tobias, and Edna his wife, and Sarah his daughter, with all his company.

Tobias also went on his way rejoicing, and praising God for that he had given him such a wife. And when they came near to Nineveh, Azarias said, 'Brother Tobias, thou knowest that my father and mother look every day for thee: Let us go before, and prepare the house.'

Then Tobias said, 'I will go with thee.' So they went both together, and Azarias did salute Tobit, and Anna his mother, and said, 'Your son Tobias is alive, and is coming.' So they went forth to meet their son, and did embrace him, and blessed God.
Now Tobit his father counted every day: and when the days of the journey were expired, and they came not,
Then Tobit said, 'Are they detained? Or is Gabael dead, and no man to give him the money?'
Therefore he was exceedingly sorry.
Then his wife said unto him, 'My son is dead, seeing that he stayeth long;' and she began to wail him,
and said, 'I have sent away the light of mine eyes, and have lost him.'

But Tobit said unto her, 'Hold thy peace, take no thought for him, he is safe.' But she said, 'Hold thy peace, and deceive me not; my son is dead.' And she went out every day into the way which they went, and did eat no meat on the day time, and ceased not whole nights to bewail her son Tobias, before the Lord. Now when Raguel had heard that Tobias was returned, he went to meet him, and blessed God,

and said, 'Blessed art thou, O God, that thou hast spared thy servants, and hast had mercy on them.' And when they came near to Nineveh, Azarias said unto Tobias, 'Brother, thou knowest that my father and mother look every day for thee.'
Let us haste to meet them, and to let them know that we are returned.'
Then they went their way, and met Tobit, and Anna his mother, and Anna embraced him, and said, 'I have seen my son, and he is returned!'

And forthwith Raguel gave Sarah his wife unto him, and he gave unto Tobias half of his goods, menservants and maidservants, and oxen, and sheep, and asses, and camels, and raiment, and silver, and household stuff.

Thus he took his leave of them, blessed. And he said unto him, My son, fare thou well, and the Lord of heaven prosper you both in peace. And he spake unto Sarah, My daughter, I shall not fail to see thy children before I die.

Then he took his leave of his daughter Sarah, and said unto her, Daughter, honour thy father and thy mother in law, which are now thy parents, that I may hear good report of thee. And he kissed her. Edna also said to Tobias, The Lord of heaven restore thee, my dear brother, and grant that I may see thy children of my daughter Sarah before I die, that I may rejoice before the Lord. Behold, I commit my daughter unto thee of special trust; wherefore do not entreat her evil. And Tobias said, As the Lord liveth, I will not leave thee to be troubled. And they went their way rejoicing. Then Edna said unto Tobias, The Lord of heaven bless thee and Sarah thy wife, and may I see your children before I die. And she kissed them both.

Tobias departed from Raguel rejoicing, and blessing God for that he had given him a fair wife of his own kindred, who stole not, but were his by right of inheritance. Then he blessed Raguel and Edna, saying, The Lord God of heaven bless you; and grant you all things that are for your good.
And they drew near to Kaserin, over against Nineveh.
Then Raphael said, Thou knowest, brother Tobias, how thou didst leave thy father.
Let us haste before thy wife, and prepare the house. And take in thine hand the gall of the fish.
So they went their way, and the dog went after them.
And Anna sat looking about toward the way for her son.
And when she espied him coming afar off, she said to his father, Behold, thy son cometh, and the man that went with him.
Then Raphael said, I know, Tobias, that thy father will open his eyes.
Therefore anoint thou his eyes with the gall; and being pricked therewith, he shall rub, and the white films shall fall away from his eyes, and he shall see thee.
Then Anna ran forth to meet her son, and embraced him, and said unto him, Seeing I have seen thee, my son, from henceforth I am content to die. And they wept both together.
Tobit also went forth toward the door, and stumbled: but his son ran unto him,
And took hold of his father: and he strake of the gall on his eyes, saying, Be of good hope, my father.
And when his eyes smarted, he rubbed them,
And the white films peeled away from the corners of his eyes:
And when he saw his son, he fell upon his neck,

And wept, and said, Blessed art thou, O God, and blessed is thy name for ever; and blessed are all thine holy angels: For thou hast scourged, and hast taken pity on me: for, behold, I see Tobias my son. And Tobias went in rejoicing, and told his father the great things that had happened to him in Media. And Tobit went out to meet his daughter in law at the gate of Nineveh, rejoicing.
And when they which led her were come thither, they went their way.
